Electricity Capacity Notes:
350 of captive coal plants, owned by PT Baoshuo Taman Industry Investment Group (BTIIG), are currently under construction. In 2023, PLN Indonesia Power signed an MOU with China Energy Engineering Corporation and BTIIG to develop 5,000 MW of captive power through hydropower and solar power plants. Local community members and WALHI Central Sulawesi have protested the development of the captive coal plants, due to their proximity to community settlements and failure to conduct AMDAL socialization; see Dispute Explanations.

(Global Energy Monitor, 7/18/2024, www.gem.wiki/PT_IHIP_power_station): PT IHIP Power Station
"PT IHIP power station is a power station under construction in Ambunu, West Bungku, Morowali, Central Sulawesi, Indonesia."
Unit 1: 117 MW, under construction
Unit 2: 117 MW, under construction
Unit 3: 116 MW, under construction
All three units are expected to begin operating in 2024.

(Investor.ID, 5/31/2023): PLN IP Develops 5,000 MW Captive Power in Morowali Industrial Area
"PLN Indonesia Power is collaborating with China Energy Engineering Corporation (CEEC) and Baoshuo Taman Industry Investment Group (BTIIG) in developing Captive Power of up to 5000 Megawatts (MW) in the Morowali Industrial Area, Central Sulawesi.
The renewable energy development cooperation was strengthened in the signing of a memorandum of understanding between PLN Indonesia Power President Director Edwin Nugraha Putra with CEEC Vice President Director Yuan Yingli and BTIIG President Director Cai Zhengyang. The signing was witnessed by the Ambassador of the Republic of Indonesia to the People's Republic of China Djauhari Oratmangun and President Director of PT PLN (Persero) Darmawan Prasodjo and PLN President Commissioner Amien Sunaryadi. 
Darmawan said that PLN Group continues to be committed to fulfilling the electricity needs of the archipelago, in this case for the Baoshuo Industrial Area, by developing environmentally friendly power plants. This is also an effort made by PLN Group together with prospective strategic partners in order to increase development that leads to increased national economic growth.
"This meeting opens up clear cooperation to meet the electricity needs of the Baoshuo industrial area, we are committed to providing electricity supply according to Baoshuo's needs with the development of PLTA and PLTS phase 1 with an estimated capacity of 5,000 MW and the next development stage in Sulawesi," said Darmawan in his statement in Jakarta, Wednesday (31/5).
"We hope that through this collaboration, both CEEC and PLN's businesses in the electricity sector will strengthen each other in the future," added Darmawan.
PLN Indonesia Power President Director Edwin Nugraha Putra said that together with CEEC, which is one of the largest energy solution business providers in China and is competent in developing green energy , it is hoped that this effort can accelerate the captive power project .
"As the largest Generation Company in Southeast Asia, we continue to strive to develop renewable energy in Indonesia and in order to support the government's target to realize 23% renewable energy by 2025, therefore, together with CEEC, which is one of the largest energy solution business providers in China and is competent in developing green energy, we will collaborate to make it happen," said Edwin.
Foreign Company Involvement Notes:
China -- PT Baoshuo Taman Industry Investment Group, the manager and company responsible for construction IHIP, is a subsidiary of Chinese company Zhensi Holding Group Co. Global Energy Monitor lists the parents of BT Baoshuo Taman Industry Investment Group as Huakai Investment Co Ltd, Tongxiang Wushi Trading Co Ltd, and Zhenshi Holding Group Co Ltd. Chinese cobalt company Nanjing Hanrui Cobalt Co also reported signed a MoU to jointly develop a nickel HPAL project with IHIP. Baoshuo Taman Industry Investment Group has also signed an MOU China Energy Engineering Corporation and PLN Indonesia Power for the development of renewable captive power facilities (see Electricity Capacity Notes).
IHIP is also designated a Zhejiang provincial overseas economic and trade cooperation zone.

(Zhejiang China, 5/25/2023, zhejiang.chinadaily.com.cn): ​Jiaxing's 1st provincial overseas economic, trade cooperation zone approved
"Zhenshi Indonesia Huabao Industrial Park was recently designated a Zhejiang provincial overseas economic and trade cooperation zone by the Department of Commerce of Zhejiang Province, making it the first of its kind in Jiaxing.
Zhenshi Indonesia Huabao Industrial Park, located in Morowali county, Sulawesi island, Indonesia, is a nickel resource comprehensive utilization industrial park led by Zhenshi Holdings Group based in Jiaxing, covering an area of 20,000 hectares.
The park started construction in March 2022, focusing on the production of electricity and energy, red soil nickel ore smelting, comprehensive processing of nickel resources and production of terminal products.
"The world's red soil nickel ore is mainly distributed throughout tropical countries within 30 degrees north and south of the equator. Among them, Indonesia boasts the largest reserves and highest quality. Its nickel ore exports account for about 20 percent of the global total," said Cai Zhengyang, the park's executive general manager.
After smelting, laterite nickel ore will immediately produce nickel iron blocks and nickel hydroxide, which are important raw materials for producing stainless steel. Nickel hydroxide is currently indispensable to the production of high-end new energy batteries.
The park's nickel iron smelting production line is expected to be put into operation by the end of 2023.
Multiple Chinese enterprises have signed contracts to set up operations in the industrial park, which is expected to create about 15,000 jobs for locals."

(Asian Metal, 9/22/2022, asianmetal.com): Hanrui Cobalt to build 60,000-metal-ton nickel high-pressure leaching project in Indonesia Huabao Industrial Park
"Nanjing Hanrui Cobalt announced on September 19 that the company and Indonesia Huabao Industrial Park Investment Group Co., Ltd. reached a memorandum on the cooperative construction of 60,000-metal-ton nickel high-pressure leaching project. Both parties intend to jointly invest in the establishment of a project company to be responsible for the construction and operation of the cooperative project.
Status Notes:
Indonesia Huabao Industrial Park is an under-construction nickel industrial park run by PT Baoshuo Taman Industry Investment Group (BTIIG) a subsidiary of Zhensi Holding Group Co. Construction began in March 2022, and a consultation on PT BTIIG's Amdal report was held in March 2023. Sources report conflicting land area of the industrial park (20,000 hectares versus 7,187 hectares); conservatively recording size as 7,187 hectares. 

(Indonesia Business Post, 8/19/2024, indonesiabusinesspost.com): Residents sued for blocking production road in PT IHIP industrial zone
"...PT BTIIG is a nickel smelter-based management company located within PT IHIP industrial zone. PT IHIP’s share composition consists of Zhensi Indonesia Industrial Park with 51percent, Beijing Shengyue Oriental Invesment Co., Ltd with 10.28 percent, PT Kejayaan Emas Persada 27.45percent, and PT Himalaya Global Investment 11.27 percent, with an investment value of Rp14 trillion rupiah. The 20,000-hectare industrial zone is located in the villages of Wata, Tondo, Ambunu, Topogaro, Upanga, Larebonu and Wosu. The development is part of a pilot zone for high-quality international cooperation under the “One Belt, One Road Initiative.”

(Zhensi Group, 5/29/2023, en.zhensigroup.com): Jiaxing's first breakthrough in 'zero' Zhenshi Indonesia Huabao Industrial Park Approved as a Provincial Overseas Economic and Trade Cooperation Park
"[Indonesia Huabao Industrial Park has] been confirmed as a provincial-level overseas economic and trade cooperation zone, becoming the first approved provincial-level overseas economic and trade cooperation zone in Jiaxing City, achieving a breakthrough of "zero" in Jiaxing's overseas economic and trade cooperation zone.
Adhering to the concept of "investing outside, utilizing resources outside, and providing returns within, and developing oneself", Zhenshi Indonesia Huabao Industrial Park has emerged. The park is located in Morowali County, Sulawesi Island, Indonesia, with a total planned area of approximately 20000 hectares, dedicated to creating a full industry chain processing and manufacturing base for "laterite nickel iron stainless steel" and "laterite new energy battery materials new energy batteries and recycling".
In March 2022, the Zhenshi Indonesia 2201&2202 project was fully launched, with ships of materials and batches of personnel going overseas, land acquisition and reclamation, logistics support, material procurement, on-site construction... All Zhenshi personnel overcame all difficulties, scientifically planned, ensured quality and quantity, and steadily promoted project construction. One by one, the park's "landmarks" demonstrating Zhenshi's speed were completed. The appearance of Zhenshi Indonesia Huabao Industrial Park is changing day by day, with temporary docks, living camps, canteens, and other facilities quickly put into use. Mixing plants, gravel lines, brick factories, and barge docks have been completed and put into operation. The park is planned to be initially completed and put into use by the end of 2023.
The approval of the provincial overseas economic and trade cooperation zone is the result of Zhenshi's extension of the "sweet potato economy" vine, and also highly affirms Zhenshi's positive response to the national "the Belt and Road" initiative. The construction of Zhenshi Indonesia Huabao Industrial Park will help domestic enterprises gather together to go global, accelerate the pace of "going global", reduce the cost of "going global", and utilize foreign advantageous resources to serve domestic economic development. It will actively promote international production capacity cooperation and global value chain layout, and achieve win-win results in both international and domestic markets."

(Topkota.co, 3/1/2023): Opening Public Consultation on PT BTIIG's Amdal, Morowali Regent Hopes It's Not Just Ceremonial
"Morowali Regent Drs Taslim officially opened a public consultation on the Environmental Impact Analysis (Amdal) study of PT Baoshuo Taman Investment Industry Group (BTIIG), at the Bungku Barat Sub-district Office Hall, Monday (27/2/2023).
This consultation was held in the context of the industrial area development plan with a land area of ​​7,187 hectares, located in a number of villages in the Bungku Barat and Bumi Raya Districts.
In the consultation, the CEO of PT BTIIG Mr. Ghao, Kasdim 1311 Morowali, Heads of OPDs within the Morowali Regency Government, Head of Bungku Barat Sub-district, Elements of the Bungku Barat Sub-district Forkopimcam, PT BTIIG Amdal Consultant Team, representatives of PT BTIIG Management, Village Heads and BPD members throughout Bungku Barat Sub-district, community leaders, youth leaders and members of the Press.
On that occasion, CEO of PT BTIIG Mr Ghao expressed his gratitude to all parties who had given attention and support for the development of the PT BTIIG industrial area.
Mr Ghao said when carrying out the construction of the industrial area, the company will pay attention to ecological protection and strive to make a positive contribution to promoting local social development and environmental protection.
"Hopefully, with the public consultation, all parties can provide input, suggestions and opinions and provide a complete picture of various aspects related to the PT. BTIIG company environment," he said.
He continued, the environmental impact assessment of the industrial area in this consultation, which covers an area of ​​more than seven thousand hectares and more than ten villages affected by it. "Therefore today we are seeking opinions and input from related parties, both social groups and experts in related fields who may be affected by the implementation of the project construction and individuals who care about the social environmental impact," he said.
Meanwhile, the Regent of Morowali, Drs Taslim, emphasized that the consultation was not merely ceremonial, but this activity must be a space that must be utilized as well as possible by all parties to perfect the Amdal document that will be used as a guideline by the company in operating in the future.
"I hope we must give each other advice and input, our presence in this place is not just ceremonial but represents the entire community, discussing the sustainability of life in various aspects in the future. And my hope is to really be a vehicle for the Amdal consultant team. To get input in order to compile an Amdal that can be a document for company guidelines in carrying out activities," said Taslim.
"Don't repeat the same mistake, I really want a quality Amdal document. Therefore, let's learn and make the existing experience so that it doesn't happen again," added Taslim.
The public consultation was continued and guided by the moderator, Bungku Barat Sub-district Head Jalaludin Ismail SH. For your information, the public consultation event is a mandatory stage according to the mandate of the regulation. This process is carried out to identify cross-sector impacts from industrial activities until after the development project is completed."
Dispute Explanations:
IHIP has been accused of seizing local resident land without fair compensation since to 2020, causing agricultural failures and damage to local livelihoods. In addition, IHIP has been accused by local residents and activists, including the Central Sulawesi WALHI chapter, of seizing a community road and building a PLTU without proper permits and socialization of environmental impact assessments (AMDAL). In summer 2024, local activists blocked the Topogaro Farm Road in protest of the company seizing the road. In July 2024, activists from the United Ambunu Forum of West Bungku District, Morowali Regency and WALHI Central Sulawesi chapter issued a complaint to the National Human Rights Commission (Komnas HAM) and the Ombudsman over the IHIP’s claim of Topogaro Farm road. In August 2024, IHIP sued four village residents in August 2024 for blocking the road. The current status of the road is unclear, as the Morowali Regency legislative council moved to annul their MoU with IHIP, yet IHIP claims to still own the road through a separate MoU.

Local activists have also protested the building of captive coal power plants close to existing community settlements due to the potential pollution and negative impact on community health. In August 2024, a worker at IHIP was killed in an accident while processing nickel ore. 

Land Acquisition Issues:

(Indonesia Business Post, 8/19/2024, indonesiabusinesspost.com): Residents sued for blocking production road in PT IHIP industrial zone
"Land conflicts between residents of Topogaro and Tondo villages in Morowali regency, Central Sulawesi, and PT Indonesia Huabao Industrial Park (PT IHIP) industrial zone heat up with four village residents being sued by a tenant of the industrial zone for blocking its production road.
Four villagers of Morowali, namely Rahman Ladanu, Safaat, Sadam, and Imran, received a summons from the Poso District Court on August 15, 2024 following the lawsuit filed by PT Baoshuo Taman Industri Invesment Group (BTIIG), a tenant in PT IHIP. They have been reported to the Court for blocking the production road within PT IHIP and demanded to compensate a material loss of Rp4.3 billion (US$277,000) following three days of idle production as a result of three days of road blockade in early June 2024.
The villagers bocked the road in the wake of a video footage circulated by Cipto Rustianto, an External Legal Staff of PT IHIP, declaring the disputed road is the legal property of PT IHIP based on the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) of asset swap with the Regent of Morowali.
The Topogaro farm road, which is now the production road within PT IHIP, long before the existence of a nickel company, was used by the local community as a dirt path.
“It served as the villagers’ access to the Topogaro Cave (cultural site) and coffe and cocoa plantations as well as rice fields,” Wandi, a campaigner for Central Sulawesi Chapter of the Indonesian Environmental Forum (WALHI), said in a statement on Monday, August 19, 2024.
The community’s anger over the unilateral claim of the farm road by the company extended to neighboring Ambunu Village, whose residents have had to detour and take a longer distance to travel as the farm road had converted into company buildings and warehouses.
“Until now, PT IHIP has never shown the MoU on the asset swap agreement. Amid the villagers’ blockade of production road, PT BTIIG has launched seven legal attempts to criminalize the residents, ranging from subpoenas, police summonses, to lawsuits,” Wandi said.
He added that unilateral claim of the farm road possession by the company was not the only atrocity allegedly committed by the company.
“There have been efforts by PT IHIP to silence the community fighting for their rights. There was also forced eviction of 14 hectares of productive oil palm land belonging to 12 families of Ambunu Village on October 17, 2022 without the knowledge of the owners,” Wandi said.
PT BTIIG is a nickel smelter-based management company located within PT IHIP industrial zone. PT IHIP’s share composition consists of Zhensi Indonesia Industrial Park with 51percent, Beijing Shengyue Oriental Invesment Co., Ltd with 10.28 percent, PT Kejayaan Emas Persada 27.45percent, and PT Himalaya Global Investment 11.27 percent, with an investment value of Rp14 trillion rupiah. The 20,000-hectare industrial zone is located in the villages of Wata, Tondo, Ambunu, Topogaro, Upanga, Larebonu and Wosu. The development is part of a pilot zone for high-quality international cooperation under the “One Belt, One Road Initiative.”

(Indonesia Business Post, 7/30/2024, indonesiabusinesspost.com): Local community complains about farm road grab case in Morowali
"A dozen of resident representatives grouped under the United Ambunu Forum of West Bungku District, Morowali Regency, along with activists of the Indonesian Forum for the Environment (WALHI) Central Sulawesi chapter, have complained to the National Human Rights Commission (Komnas HAM) and the Ombudsman over the claim made by a Chinese nickel smelter company on a farm road in the regency.
They went to the Ombudsman’s Central Sulawesi Office on July 25, 2024. On the following day, they went to the office of the Central Sulawesi chapter of Kommnas HAM to file a letter of complaint against a Memorandum of Agreement on asset swaps and other criminal acts allegedly conducted by PT Indonesia Huabao Industrial Park.
“The letter contains chronology of the incidents, history of farm road, coordinate points, the decree by the Morowali regency administration that annuls the MOU on asset swaps and minutes of Morowali regency legislative council hearing,” Wandi, a campaigner for WALHI’s Central Sulawesi chapter, said.
Local community has launched the protest in the last two months. They blocked farm road claimed by PT Indonesia Huabao Industrial Park until the Morowali regency legislative council hearing on July 14, 2024 that failed to reach a settlement agreement. The ensuing annulment by the Morowali regency legislative council on the MoU, however, was apparently ignored by PT Indonesia Huabao Industrial Park, which then established a smelter and nickel ore warehouse on the road.
“We are disappointed because the loss of people’s living space and the fact that the company’s presence impoverishes the people slowly under the pretext that nicklel investment will encourage an increase of people’s welfare,” Ramadhan, chairman of the United Ambunu Forum, said in a statement on Tuesday, July 30, 2024.
The Central Sulawesi chapter of WALHI accuses the Morowali regency administration and the Central Sulawesi provincial administration have ignored the people’s basic rights and prioritized the interest of the company by rolling out red carpet for land grabbing,” Wandi said.
“Therefore, we ask the Komnas HAM to protect the activists and the people living around PT Indonesia Huabao Industrial Park. We also ask the Ombudsman to review the MOU between the Morowali administration and PT Indonesia Huabao Industrial Park on asset swaps and the Central Sulawesi administration to return the farm road ownership back to the people,” he added."

(Mongabay, 7/5/2024, mongabay.co.id): Affected Communities Protest IHIP Nickel Industrial Area Project in Morowali
"The nickel industrial area development project, PT Indonesia Huabao Industrial Park (IHIP) in Bungku Barat District, Morowali, Central Sulawesi (Sulteng) was marred by agrarian conflict. In the end, four residents had to deal with the law because of the road blockade action to stop the company's activities.
The story goes, on March 11, 2024, residents of Tondo and Topogaro Villages. blocked the road that the company unilaterally claimed as the company's hauling road. The residents were furious and built tents in the middle of the road to stop production activities.
Wandi, a campaigner for Walhi Central Sulawesi, said that the blockade began when a video circulated of a statement from Riski, an external legal representative of IHIP, stating that the current farm road was a company road legally owned by IHIP.
The unilateral claim is based on a memorandum of understanding (MoU) for asset exchange with the Morowali Regent. In return, IHIP worked on expanding the airport. In fact, the road is the main access for the community to their land, such as coffee, cocoa, and rice fields. The road also leads to a cultural site, Topogaro Cave.
The MoU that the company and the regent made was not known to the public at all, there was no notification or socialization. Suddenly, the farm road had become a company road.
Public access to the gardens is also disrupted due to the activity of heavy equipment passing by every day.
 The unilateral claim also sparked public anger that spread to Ambunu Village, a village around IHIP. On June 15, residents of Ambunu Village also joined the road blockade, right next to the IHIP flyover , where ore, coal, and smelter storage warehouses have been built.
"The road blockade action by residents of Ambunu Village was attended by approximately 500 people spread across three points," he said.
The demands of the West Bungku residents are asking the Morowali Government to cancel the MoU. They also want to see the MoU in the hands of the company, but IHIP is reluctant to show the document, instead saying that the document is confidential.
Instead of responding to the demands of the community, said Wandi, IHIP actually issued a warning to the blockade action movers. The first warning was given to four residents of Tondo and Topogaro Villages for the June 11 action. The warning was given to Rahman Ladanu, Wahid/Imran, Hamdan, and Safaat. The four people were also reported to the Central Sulawesi Regional Police.
Not only that, said Wandi, IHIP also made a second warning to five residents of Ambunu Village for the blockade and barricading actions that resulted in the company's activities stopping on June 15. These five people are Moh Haris Rabbie, Makmur Ms, Abd Ramdhan, Hasrun, and Rifiana MS.
"So, there were 9 people summoned by IHIP, four were reported to the Central Sulawesi Regional Police."
The Morowali government finally canceled the MoU. The decision was taken at a meeting between the community, the company, and the Morowali government, along with Forkopimda elements, on June 22.
The company remains adamant that the MoU is still valid because the cancellation was unilateral.
However, Wandi said, the cancellation of the MoU still confused residents. Because, based on the official release of IHIP and the Morowali Regional Government, the MoU was signed on December 22, 2023.
In the minutes of the cancellation of the MoU received by the public, the MoU that was cancelled refers to the MoU dated March 11, 2024.
"Both MoUs use the phrase 'use of assets' while in the widely circulated video the MoU read by IHIP's external legal team uses the phrase 'exchange assets'. Are there any other MoUs?" he asked.
Rifiana MS, a resident of Ambunu Village who attended the company's summons, said that the Morowali Government seemed to be playing around with the community's demands because it seemed to be taking sides and protecting the company's interests.
He said, the Morowali Government wanted to try to stop their movement, without a clear agreement.
The reconciliation efforts mediated by the Morowali Government did not find a bright spot, instead the debate became more massive. The unilateral claims explained by the Morowali Regional Government could not answer the demands of the community. The Morowali Government, he said, continued to insist on stopping the road blockade movement.
"We were asked to stop our action, however, we still refused and continued the action with the demand to cancel the MoU," said Rifiana in a press conference at the end of June.
In addition to canceling the MoU, he said, residents asked for the road status to be handed over to the community. They also questioned the procedures of the Morowali Government to dare to hand over the road to IHIP.
"If our demands are not heeded by the Morowali Government, we will blockade the farm road again. We believe that the farm road belongs to the community, not the company."
 Cipto Rustianto, External Manager of IHIP denied all accusations from the public. The company, he said, is the result of coordination and approval from the central and regional governments, in accordance with applicable regulations. He claims that he has never encroached on people's farm roads, and is ready to prove it with data and facts.
Cipto also denied criminalizing citizens. He said the accusation of criminalization was baseless. So far, they have been committed to protecting the interests of the community in economic activities according to applicable laws. The company, he said, is trying to embrace the community through village governments and related institutions. "Therefore, I invite all parties to respect the ongoing legal process and hand over the handling to the competent authorities," said Cipto as quoted in Media Alkhairaat .
IHIP is an Indonesian company with Chinese capital. The stock composition consists of Zhensi Indonesia Industrial Park 51%, Beijing Shengyue Oriental Investment Co., Ltd 10.28%, PT Kejayaan Emas Persada 27.45%, and PT Himalaya Global Investment 11.27%...
In Indonesia, the parent company of Zhensi Holding Group to build the IHIP area is PT Bahosua Taman Industri Investment Grup (BTIIG). This industrial area is located in seven villages in Morowali Regency, namely; Topogaro Village, Wata, Ambunu, Tondo, Umpanga, Larobenu, and Wosu. This Rp14 trillion investment project will be built on an area of ​​around 20,000 hectares.
IHIP and BTIIG will build this industrial area with a two-stage scheme. First , build 1,200 hectares in Ambunu, Topogaro, and Tondo which are currently problematic because the claim for the farm road was made unilaterally. Second , build 18,800 hectares in five other villages…
Covert land grabbing
The project, which is claimed to be part of the energy transition work, is actually eroding the surrounding community. Land and roads that are the main access for people to farm and earn a living are seized in various ways and trigger agrarian conflicts.
Yusman, Walhi Sulteng Campaigner said, what happened in Ambunu Village, Topogaro, and Tondo was not the first agrarian conflict. In Morowali, it has been massive since the nickel company took root exploiting natural resources. The modes of land grabbing are also varied, including IHIP smoothing their project in extracting the earth's contents, one of which is the wrong eviction mode. IHIP once took 14 hectares of productive oil palm land from Ambunu residents with the wrong eviction mode at night on October 17, 2022.
When the community protested, Yusman said, the company immediately offered compensation. This condition left farmers with no other choice but to accept compensation. In 2020, he said, IHIP was also suspected of filling in irrigation channels for mining roads that affected 170 hectares of rice fields belonging to 20 families.
The filling of the irrigation channels caused the rice fields to no longer be productive. The company took advantage of the moment to immediately negotiate by offering to buy the community's rice fields. Currently, he said, of the 170 hectares of community rice fields, only 10 hectares are still being managed.
"The filling of the irrigation channel changed the river channel and 36 hectares of community rice fields were submerged in water," said Yusma.
Not only that. The IHIP reclamation to build a special jetty terminal covering 40 hectares in Tondo and Ambunu Villages has caused 115 seaweed fishermen to lose their livelihoods. In fact, he said, the reclamation did not have a permit and had been sealed by the Directorate General of PSDKP for violating Law 32/2009.
In addition, there is an allegation that IHIP does not have an industrial area business permit (IUKI) and an environmental permit (amdalalin). In fact, the company has currently built three captive PLTUs with a capacity of 350 MW, a smelter stockpile ore there.
Yusman urged that the MoU for the exchange of farm road assets in Topogaro and Ambunu Villages be completely cancelled. He also asked the company to stop criminalizing four Topogaro and Tondo residents. He also urged the Morowali DPRD to take action on the unilateral claim of the IHIP farm road through the MoU. The relevant ministry, he said, must also evaluate and provide a moratorium on the IHIP because the development of the nickel industry does not have a permit for the area and environment, as well as examine the Acting Regent of Morowali.
“Stop the practice of covert land grabbing and ask the government for supervision.”"

(Teraskabar, 1/9/2024, teraskabar.id): Residents worried about BTIIG Morowali PLTU SUTET stretching across densely populated settlements
"The Industrial Area Community Movement (GMKI) invites all Morowali people, community leaders, youth leaders and groups to voice their joint demands against PT. Indonesia Huabao Industrial Park (  PT. IHIP ) or PT. Bahosuo Taman Industri Investment Group (  PT. BTIIG ) in Bungku Barat District, Morowali Regency, Central Sulawesi.
The demands voiced related to the construction of the Steam Power Plant (PLTU) where the Sutet poles and cables cross through densely populated residential areas. Including the impact of pollution that will be caused later after the PLTU has been operating. Because, there are several villages that are directly affected, namely Topogaro Village, Ambunu Village, Tondo Village, and Wata Village.
Therefore, GMKI held a meeting in Wata Village on Saturday (6/1/2024), discussing the possible impacts that will be borne by residents in the industrial area after the operation of the PLTU along with the construction and stretching of SUTET cables that cross densely populated settlements.
The results of the meeting were then agreed upon by a number of representatives of residents who were present, then the points of agreement were read out by Wajir Muhaimin as the chairman of GMKI Morowali Regency.
The 11 points of demands read out by Wajir were:
1. Construction of PLTU location without socialization of Environmental Impact Analysis (Amdal)
2. Illegal mining without a permit
3. Land grabbing of local residents
4. Land compensation that has not been completed
5. Destruction of community facilities of fishermen without compensation.
6. Termination of Employment Contracts and unilateral termination of employment (PHK) for local residents
7. Closing space for local companies
8. There is no good planning from the company regarding the spatial planning of the company's environment with residential areas and the distance between residents.
9. The PLTU high-voltage power cables pass above residents' houses
10. There are bad activities from companies crowding foreign citizens with fellow Chinese
11. Meanwhile, Indonesian citizens (WNI) are stepchildren.
The 11 points of demands were then increased by 6 points, becoming seventeen points based on the aspirations of the residents' representatives who attended the meeting.
The points in question are,
1. There is no clarity regarding compensation for affected communities.
2. Immediately relocate and resolve the issue of compensation for residents' houses crossed by the PLTU cables and high-voltage power lines.
3. Compensation and relocation of people's homes close to the PLTU due to radiation hazards is mandatory
4. The companies PT. IHIP and PT. BTIIG are suspected of not accepting local residents as security employees, as if they wanted to pit locals against people from outside the region, when this investment should be guarded by local people.
5. Urge PT. IHIP or PT. BTIIG to show the national Traffic Impact Analysis permit
6. PT. IHIP or PT. BTIIG will immediately compensate the seaweed farmers of Pebotoa Village.
In the meeting, it was also revealed that the reason why residents calling themselves GMKI Morowali held a meeting was because PT IHIP or PT BTIIG was building a PLTU but had never socialized its AMDAL to residents in the industrial area.
"PT. IHIP or PT. BTIIG today is building a PLTU and has never conducted socialization regarding environmental impact analysis, the question is why Pebotoa village can receive impact compensation but has never been socialized," he said.
Therefore, GMKI held a meeting to try to minimize arbitrary actions by companies so that they do not continue to occur against residents around the mining area.
Wajir continued, for the initial target, his party will immediately block PT. BTIIG's access to the Play Offair and give a speech in front of the PT. IHIP or PT. BTIIG company office.
In the same place, as a member of Ambunu Village, Ahmad hopes that GMKI will truly fight for the aspirations of the people in the industrial circle, not merely for personal interests. "Then if we look for mistakes and problems with the presence of PT  . IHIP , we don't need to look for them, they are all already in our own heads," he said.
Ahmad, said that regarding the issue of licensing, the company must first socialize the AMDAL to the local community, starting from the village level, sub-district level and district level…"

Worker's rights dispute:
Worked killed while processing nickel ore at IHIP from hot calcine dust.
(Mongabay, 8/24/2024, mongabay.co.id): Another Death, Why Do Work Accidents in Nickel Factories Keep Repeating?
"- Workers or laborers experience work accidents in factories in the nickel industrial area in Central Sulawesi, continuously recurring. This time, workers of PT Indonesia Huabao Industrial Park (IHIP) or PT Baoshuo Taman Industri Investment Group (BTIIG) experienced a work accident while processing nickel ore, August 18 in Morowali Regency, Central Sulawesi. One worker died. The temporary suspicion is that this incident occurred due to hot calcine dust from the disposal.
- Henry Foord Jebs, Chairman of the Morowali Mining and Energy Industry Workers Union (SBIPE), regretted the minimal accountability of the company in accidents, including last year's major explosion. The company should have been audited by an independent team involving the labor union.
- Trend Asia notes that from 2015-2023, there were 93 work accidents at nickel smelters in Indonesia. ITSS, the highest contributor to worker deaths, was involved in the explosion incident in December 2023 that resulted in 21 deaths and 30 injuries.
- In line with research from China Labor Watch (CLW) published on December 22, 2023. The report investigated the nickel production plan by delving into labor practices at Indonesia's largest nickel production industry project backed by Chinese capital. The report said that for almost a decade, horrific workplace deaths have continued to occur in the nickel industry in Indonesia. Substandard safety practices are the main cause of a series of accidents and deaths in the workplace."
Main Industry Notes: Nickel
Tenants: Nanjing Hanrui Cobalt
